bibl.title: The Effects of the Seven Deadly Sins
bibl.note: Transcribed from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Fr.e.22, with variants from Trinity College, Cambridge MS B.14.39 and Cambridge, Emmanuel College MS I.4.4 (83)

list.head:
Pride makes
man
list.item: Boast of having good qualities that he does not have
Pretend to be other than he is
Fabricate novelties
Strive needlessly
Disobedient to God and to his neighbour
Perverse and contrary. Quarrel without cause

list.head: Envy
list.item:
makes man denigrate
denigrate betray denigrate
his neighbour
Take joy in the harm of another
Hate the good of another
Grouch over the advancement of another
Be one who commits homicide
Be of bitter intent
Corrupt the good of another
Makes man swell with rage In the Emmanuel College manuscript, this branch of "Ire" and the next two are all on the same line.
Go mad

list.head: Ire
list.item:
Cry out
Cry out Cry out and chatter Cry out
Mock his neighbour

Threaten
Threaten Insult Threaten. Insult

Insult
Insult
Threaten
Blind the intellect so that he cannot understand the truth

list.head: Sloth
list.item:
makes man displeased displeased displeased vexed with every good and
often often with his own life
Heavy of heart, and lazy, and sleepy
Negligent of the things he ought to do
More timid than is necessary

Abounding in weary looks Where "plentivus" is followed by "de," I have translated it as "abounding," following the Anglo-Norman dictionary, and where it is followed by the conjunction "e," I have taken it as the adjective "plaintif," meaning "wretched."
Abounding in weary looks Wretched and of weary countenance Wretched and of weary countenance
Often in despair
Be without the comfort of the holy spirit

list.head: Avarice
list.item:
makes man think up new tricks so that he can
more craftily
more craftily deceive his neighbour
Desire the death of his neighbour
Lie, perjure, and give false testimony

Steal and seize wrongfully
wrongfully wrongfully from everyone
Flatter those who are bad
Consent to all sin
Give false verdicts

list.head: Lechery
list.note: In the Bodleian MS, the order of these last two lists is reversed.
list.item:
makes man filthy in both body
body heart body and spirit
Stink before God and his angels

Become foolish
Become foolish Foolish Foolish in thought
Speak of vulgarity and filth
Think of harm

Flatter and beguile
and beguile
everyone to make his mischief
Chase away the Holy Spirit, and uncouth and dissolute

list.head: Gluttony
list.item: makes man forget God
Destroys innate good qualities
Shortens the life of man

Takes away all
sense and memory
Reduces the strength and beauty of the body
Produces drunkenness that cannot be hidden by anything
Makes man chatter and cry out abominations
